author: Siobhan Hughes
title: Missouri Senator’s Reelection Quest Reflects Democratic Test in 2018
text:
SPRINGFIELD, Mo.—Claire McCaskill of Missouri first won election to the Senate in 2006, during one of the best years for Democrats in decades. This year will test her ability to survive in the era of President Donald Trump.
Ms. McCaskill, 64 years old, is depending on her brand as a frank politician who can mix it up with voters by taking unscripted questions at town halls and as an independent operator who gets along with Republicans in a divided Washington to secure her re-election to a third term in November.
... RELATED VIDEO Can the Democrats Ride a Blue Wave to Midterm Election Wins? The Democrats have a "blue wave" of momentum building for the 2018 midterms, thanks to a motivated base, success in special elections and a low approval rating for President Trump. Will that be enough to take back the House and the Senate?
